bibl.title: Ptolemy or Artemis? A Hellenistic Sculpture from Cos.
bibl.note: Castle of Cos (storerooms). Granite, 0,17 m. Small head of a Lagid king (Ptolemy IV or an ancestor of the deified Ptolemy IV) wearing a diadem (?) and a polos adorned with the uraeus.

bibl.title: Sculptors and Sculpture of Caria and the Dodecanese

bibl.seg: STAMPOLIDIS Nicolas, Ptolemy or Artemis? A Hellenistic Sculpture from Cos.
Ian JENKINS and Geoffrey B. WAYWELL (Edd.), Sculptors and Sculpture of Caria and the Dodecanese (London, 1997) pp. 140-144, figg. 254-256.
Castle of Cos (storerooms). Granite, 0,17 m. Small head of a Lagid king (Ptolemy IV or an ancestor of the deified Ptolemy IV) wearing a diadem (?) and a polos adorned with the uraeus.
